intro: Toronia toru, commonly known as the mountain glorybower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often woody and branched. Toronia toru is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
